channel.title: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]
channel.description:
Okay so i've made a custom rules interface with an agree, and disagree buttons.
I want to make it so if they click disagree it just logs them out. The code needs to go into clickingmost.java so it must have a c. in front of it.
Anyone know the code to D/C people upon clicking? Will rep++ for any help!

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“JGX, post:8, topic:431128”]One error.

[quote]Cannot find symbol
Symbol: Variable Playername
[/quote]
I need to define playername in my clickmost.java file for this to work.
Any ideas on how to do so?[/quote]

c.playerName

Read full topic

One error.

Cannot find symbol Symbol: Variable Playername

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

get rid of c.logout and put this:

writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true;

Read full topic
item.source: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

I know, i’m fine with that. I just want to make it so if they click “I disagree” to my servers’ rules they can’t use that account.

I want to make it so if they do click “I disagree” it won’t let them use that account, and it will add their character file to a folder titled, “Disagreements”.
(I already know how to make it so it adds the file to sed folder.)

I just need to know how to make it so they can’t log back in on that account.

Read full topic
item.source: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Making someone log out upon clicking a button. [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

JGX:

Yeah I used the same case, it worked. But they can just log back in. Is there any way I can make it so if they click ‘I disagree’ it disconnects them and doesn’t let that account ever log back in?

No. They could simply change their name, or change their IP.

Read full topic
